transcript:
voice. "Where are we? In Moscow, I know. I don't matter, but I have killed her, killed . . . She won't get over it! She won't survive. . . ." 
"Who?" asked Rost6v. 
"My mother! My mother, my angel, my adored angel mother," and D61okhov pressed Rostov's hand and burst into tears. 
When he had become a little quieter, he ex- plained to Rost6v that he was living with his mother, who, if she saw him dying, would not survive it. He implored Rost6v to go on and prepare her. 
Rost6v went on ahead
